results.title: Tunisian victory
results.creator_credit: British Army Film Unit and United States. Army. Signal Corps
results.brief_description: The final campaign of the War in North Africa, compiled from official films. Shows the main events from the Allied landings at Casablanca, Algiers and Oran on 8th November 1942 to the fall of Tunis and Bizerte on 7th May 1943 and the final mass surrender.

results.title: Tudawali
results.creator_credit: Barron Films, Paul D. Barron and Steve Steve Jodrell
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Robert Tudawali who starred in the first ever Australian technicolour feature film, “Jedda”. Station hand, actor and then Aboriginal activist, Tudawali died in 1967 at the age of 38 in tragic circumstances. Includes brief excerpts from “Jedda” and from two early television series made in Australia, “Dust in the sun” and “Whiplash” Stars Ernie Dingo in the title role.

results.title: Tucker: the man and his dream
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Lucasfilm, Ltd., Fred Roos, Fred Fuchs and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: This critically acclaimed but little seen film from Francis Coppola tells the story of Preston Tucker, who opened the door to the future in the 1940’s by building a revolutionary car that was called “The Car of tomorrow, today”. Jeff Bridges stars as family man Preston Tucker, who overcame extraordinary obstacles placed in his path by competitors and politicians, to realise his life’s dream, only to have it snatched away again. The film also features Martin Landau, Frederic Forrest, Dean Stockwell and a young Christian Slater. Original music by Carmine Coppola.

results.title: Trust
results.creator_credit: Zenith, True Fiction Pictures, Bruce Weiss and Hal Hartley
results.brief_description: Hal Hartley cemented his reputation as one of America’s leading independent filmmakers with this sometimes very black but always emotionally involving comedy about two misfits who fall in love. Adrienne Shelley is Maria, a woman constantly bullied by her lovers and her family, who falls in love with a drifter, Matthew (Martin Donovan). Matthew has been hurt too often in the past to trust women easily and his testing of Maria’s love becomes more and more fantastic and dangerous as the relationship progresses. Only through challenging her to risk life for him does Matthew believe he can be assured of her love. How these two damaged people get together, learn to have faith again, and how they remove themselves from the absurd complications of life in the late 20th Century is the theme of this fresh, contemporary and engaging film.

results.title: Trouble every day [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Canal+, Rezo Films, Arte France, Georges Benayoun, Philippe Liegeois, Jean-Michel Rey and Claire Denis
results.brief_description: Claire Denis’ “Trouble every day” is a hard to categorize genre film which seductively mixes up vampire mythology with cannibalism to explore the darker side of sexuality, fidelity and desire. The film follows parallel narratives which eventually converge, opening on a initially erotically charged heterosexual coupling which ends with the brutal murder of the male. The woman (played with mute ferocity by Beatrice Dalle), naked and covered in blood and gore is later discovered by her resigned husband (Alex Descas) who disposes of the mangled body, takes his wife home and ties her to their bed. Meanwhile an American doctor (Vincent Gallo) and his newlywed wife arrive in France for their honeymoon. Unbeknown to the young bride her husband has come to Paris with a darker agenda in mind. What begins to emerge is that the doctor and the murderess from the start of the film share a rare pathology that becomes shockingly apparent as the film plays out. Denis deliberately keeps the story opaque, instead relying heavily on mood created through the mournful and lush soundtrack by the Tindersticks and the evocative imagery, lensed by Denis’s regular cinematographer Agnes Godard. What emerges is a mysterious and compelling experience that doesn’t shy away from the more corporeal aspects of the story. Cast includes: Tricia Vessey, Florence Loiret, Nicolas Duvauchelle.

results.title: Tron
results.brief_description: Tron is a futuristic adventure made by the Disney Studios. It is about a whizkid computer programmer trapped inside a computer world where he is pitted against electronic foes. Features some impressive computer-generated animation.

results.title: Troll in Central Park
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Don Bluth Productions, Don Bluth, Gary Goldman and John Pomeroy
results.brief_description: Stanley is not your usual troll because he has a kind heart and a wonderful magical gift. His “green thumb” can create flowers at a touch. Wicked Queen Gnorga of the Trolls sends Stanley to New York where there is little green growing. He takes refuge in Central Park where he befriends Gus and Rosie. Unfortunately for the trio Queen Gnorga decides to spoil their fun and lets her mischief magic wreak havoc in the Big Apple. With the voices of Dom DeLuise, Cloris Leachman and Hayley Mills.

results.title: Triumph of the spirit
results.creator_credit: Nova International, Shimon Arama, Arnold Kopelson and Robert Young
results.brief_description: The unimaginable horror of Auschwitz is compelling recreated in this overwhelming and powerful story about fighting for survival. Salamo Arouch (Willem Dafoe) is a Greek boxer who fought in the Olympics and is sent to the Auschwitz death camp. There he must battle every day against the inevitability of death with courage and an undaunted will to live being his only weapons. His struggle is a real “Triumph of the spirit.” Co-starring Edward James Olmos and Robert Loggia.

results.title: Tristana [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Selina Cinematografia, Epoca Films, Les Films Corona, Talia Films and Luis Bunuel
results.brief_description: Fernando Rey plays Don Lope, a free thinking, Spanish dandy who’s liberal ideals are tested when he is entrusted with the guardianship of the beautiful and innocent Tristana (Catherine Deneuve). Soon enough, fatherly affection develops into full blown lust and obsession, as Don Lope coerces Tristana into becoming his lover, all the while maintaining she is free to see other men. However, Don Lope’s principals begin to fall apart when Tristana meets and falls in love with a handsome young artist (Franco Nero), sending the aging lothario into a jealous rage. Tristana is one of director Luis Bunuel’s more sombre efforts, but underlining this tragic tale of the corruption and abuse of power is his trade mark savage wit, his taste for sexual perversity (at one point a prosthetic leg is imbued with a strange erotic tension), and his contempt for the hypocrisy of the church and the ruling class. Adapted from a novel by Benito Perez Galdos. Cast includes Lola Gaos and Jesus Fernandez. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Treasure Island
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Perce Pearce and Byron Haskin
results.brief_description: A rousing, live-action adventure, based on Robert Louis Stevenson’s classic story. Young Jim Hawkins possesses a map of Treasure Island, and sets sail with a ship full of gold seekers. However, Long John Silver, a greedy crewman, quickly masterminds a mutiny, then gathers a ragged band of pirates to resume the treasure hunt…with young Hawkins as their unwilling and terrified hostage. Stars Robert Newton and Bobby Driscoll.
